page.title: 14TRANSPORT - ETTRICK VALLEY
page.content: Being a rural area the inhabitants depend mainly on their own cars for shopping trips and work. A school bus takes local pupils to the primary school in Ettrickbridge,and connects with the service bus into Selkirk.This also carries pupils to Selkirk High School. Every Tuesday there is a shopper's bus.This connects in Ettrickbridge with the Ettrick and Yarrow Community Bus,which travels to Selkirk. Farms have to bring in supplies by road, e.g. feedstuffs and fuel,and transport out their livestock to local markets, e.g. Hawick and Lockerbie. As there is a high proportion of forestry in and around the area cut timber is often transported through the valley to its various markets.
